install_msg:
Thanks for installing OCR cog. This cog utilizes Google Cloud Vision API, which will require you to have a active Google Cloud project (with billing enabled).
If you have an active Cloud project, go to this link to enable the Cloud Vision API:
 <https://console.cloud.google.com/flows/enableapi?apiid=vision.googleapis.com>

 Once you have enabled this API, go to Credentials section: <https://console.cloud.google.com/apis/credentials> to create an API key, if you haven't created one already.

â€¢ If you have previously created an unrestricted API key or created an API key just now, then copy that API key.
â€¢ If you have a restricted API key, you will need to include Cloud Vision API into Selected APIs for this API key (Note: It may take up to 5 minutes for settings to take effect.). Then copy the API key.

 You can now set your API key with:
```[p]set api google_vision api_key <copied_api_key>
``` 
 That's all you need to do. Now load the cog and test an image through OCR. ðŸ˜Š
name: Vision
short: Detect text in images using Google Cloud Vision API.
description: Detect text in images using Google Cloud Vision API.
end_user_data_statement: This cog does not persistently store data or metadata about users, but the Google Cloud Vision API might store data of images sent to be processed for text detection.
